section.section:
If an individual other than one described in paragraph (2) of this subsection has federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year greater than $100,000, the amount allowed for each exemption under subsection (a)(1) or (2) of this section is limited to:
$1,600 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year does not exceed $125,000;
$800 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year is greater than $125,000 but not greater than $150,000; and
$0 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year is greater than $150,000.

If a married couple filing a joint return or an individual described in § 2 of the Internal Revenue Code as a head of household or as a surviving spouse has federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year greater than $150,000, the amount allowed for each exemption under subsection (a)(1) or (2) of this section is limited to:
$1,600 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year does not exceed $175,000;
$800 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year is greater than $175,000 but not greater than $200,000; and
$0 if federal adjusted gross income for the taxable year is greater than $200,000.
